ptolemy.backtrack.eclipse.ast

Class Transformer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ptolemy.backtrack.eclipse.ast.Transformer

  • public class Transformer
extends java.lang.Object
    A tool to transform Java source programs to support backtracking. This transformation is done by first analyzing the Java programs, and then refactoring the program based on the information collected in the analysis phase.
    Since:
    Ptolemy II 5.1
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Thomas Feng
    Accepted Rating:
    Red (tfeng)
    Proposed Rating:
    Red (tfeng)

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static TransformRule[] RULES
      The refactoring rules to be sequentially applied to the source code.

    • Field Detail

      • RULES

        public static TransformRule[] RULES
        The refactoring rules to be sequentially applied to the source code.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Transform a set of files into backtracking-enabled ones. The set of files is given by an array of strings as their names, or the names of the directories that contain them. If a string in the array is a file name, it is refactored and the output is printed out; if it is the name of a directory, all Java files in the directory and its sub-directories are looked up and refactored in the same way.
        Parameters:
        args - The array of file names or names of directories.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If any exception occures.

      • parseArguments

        public static int parseArguments(java.lang.String[] args,
                                 int position)
        Parse the command-line arguments starting from the given position. If one or more argument corresponds to an option, proper actions are performed to record that option. The position is adjusted to the next file name or option and returned.
        Parameters:
        args - The command-line arguments.
        position - The starting position.
        Returns:
        The new position.

      • transform

        public static void transform(java.lang.String fileName,
                             org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.CompilationUnit ast,
                             java.io.Writer writer,
                             java.lang.String[] classPaths,
                             java.lang.String[] crossAnalyzedTypes)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             ASTMalformedException
        Transform the AST with given class paths, and output the result to the writer.

        If a output directory is set with the -output command-line argument, the output is written to a Java source file with that directory as the root directory. The given writer is not used in that case.

        Parameters:
        fileName - The Java file name.
        ast - The AST to be refactored.
        writer - The writer where output is written.
        classPaths - The class paths.
        crossAnalyzedTypes - The array of names of types to be added to the visitor's cross-analyzed types list.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If IO exception occurs when reading from the Java file or riting to the output.
        ASTMalformedException - If the Java source is illegal.
        See Also:
        transform(String, Writer)

      • transform

        public static void transform(java.lang.String fileName,
                             java.io.Writer writer)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             ASTMalformedException
        Transform the Java source in the file given by its name with no explicit class path, and output the result to the writer. This is the same as calling transform(fileName, writer, null).
        Parameters:
        fileName - The Java file name.
        writer - The writer where output is written.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If IO exception occurs when reading from the Java file or riting to the output.
        ASTMalformedException - If the Java source is illegal.
        See Also:
        transform(String, Writer, String[])

      • transform

        public static void transform(java.lang.String fileName,
                             java.io.Writer writer,
                             java.lang.String[] classPaths)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             ASTMalformedException
        Transform the Java source in the file given by its name with given class paths, and output the result to the writer.

        If a output directory is set with the -output command-line argument, the output is written to a Java source file with that directory as the root directory. The given writer is not used in that case.

        Parameters:
        fileName - The Java file name.
        writer - The writer where output is written.
        classPaths - The class paths.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If IO exception occurs when reading from the Java file or riting to the output.
        ASTMalformedException - If the Java source is illegal.
        See Also:
        transform(String, Writer)

      • transform

        public static void transform(java.lang.String fileName,
                             java.io.Writer writer,
                             java.lang.String[] classPaths,
                             java.lang.String[] crossAnalyzedTypes)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             ASTMalformedException
        Transform the Java source in the file given by its name with given class paths, and output the result to the writer.

        If a output directory is set with the -output command-line argument, the output is written to a Java source file with that directory as the root directory. The given writer is not used in that case.

        Parameters:
        fileName - The Java file name.
        writer - The writer where output is written.
        classPaths - The class paths.
        crossAnalyzedTypes - The array of names of types to be added to the visitor's cross-analyzed types list.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If IO exception occurs when reading from the Java file or riting to the output.
        ASTMalformedException - If the Java source is illegal.
        See Also:
        transform(String, Writer)

      • _afterTraverse

        protected void _afterTraverse()
        Call the afterTraverse of all the refactoring rules. For each rule, the afterTraverse is called after the AST is traversed. The rule may clean up states or finalize the transformation.

      • _beforeTraverse

        protected void _beforeTraverse()
        Call the beforeTraverse of all the refactoring rules. For each rule, the beforeTraverse is called before the AST is traversed. The rule may set up handlers for special events in the traversal.

      • _outputConfig

        protected static void _outputConfig()
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Output XML configuration to the pre-defined file (specified with "-config" argument in main(String[])).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If any error occurs.

      • _outputSource

        protected void _outputSource(java.io.Writer writer,
                             java.lang.String fileName)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Output the Java source from the current AST with ASTFormatter.
        Parameters:
        writer - The writer where the output is written to.
        fileName - The file name of the writer.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If error occurs while writing to the writer.

      • _parse

        protected void _parse()
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      ASTMalformedException
        Parse the Java source and retrieve the AST. If a source file name is given, the file is read and parsed; if the source is given in the form of char[], it is directly passed to the parser.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a file name is given, but exception occurs when reading from the file.
        ASTMalformedException - If the source is illegal.

      • _startTransform

        protected void _startTransform()
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               ASTMalformedException
        Start the transformation by first parsing the source with _parse(), then call _beforeTraverse(), then traverse the AST with TypeAnalyzer visitor, and finally call _afterTraverse().
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a file name is given, but exception occurs when reading from the file.
        ASTMalformedException - If the source is illegal.
        See Also:
        _afterTraverse(), _beforeTraverse(), _parse()
